item.title: Plotly Example
item.author: tom.andrew.wilson@gmail.com (Thomas Wilson)
item.description: Plots should see a plot here Code could not finish, some reasons why this could happen: - Plot name not defined. The first parameter of the shortcode is the name. - There is a syntax error. check browser console. function draw(){ test = document.getElementById("plot2"); if (test == null){ console.log("The plot name is not defined") return } fig = null var trace1 = { x: [1, 2, 3, 4], y: [10, 15, 13, 17], type: 'scatter' }; var trace2 = { x: [1, 2, 3, 4], y: [16, 5, 11, 9], type: 'scatter' }; data = [trace1, trace2]; fig = { data: data } if (!
